messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Atlanta-Puppetry Center, Kelli
messages.msgSnippet: Well,  Kelli, i guess we aren t supposed to meet up via personal E-mail.  Mine to you was returned as well.  Wierd.   I wrote that I don t want to bust into
messages.messageBody:
Well, Kelli, i guess we aren't supposed to meet up via personal E-mail. Mine to you was returned as well. Wierd. I wrote that I don't want to bust into your trip to the Puppet Center. I think I'm just so eager to meet other unschoolers; and I had just read a brochure form the Center for Puppetry Arts right before reading your E-mail. Anyway, I can give you other ideas as well of things to do in Atlanta depending on your kids' ages, if you are interested. You can try my other E-mail - madnic@...

Madeline

Kelli Traaseth <tktraas@...> wrote:
Madeline,

I tried to e-mail you, but it didn't go through. You want to e-mail me? My e-mail is below.

Thanks,

Kelli~
----- Original Message -----
From: glad2bmadly
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, August 04, 2003 4:41 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Atlanta-Puppetry Center


Yes, we have been, actually just last weekend to a Birthday party there. It is really good, some better than others of course. Maybe we could go with you. Meet you there? How old are your kids? Mine are 6 and 3. Plus we'll have visiting cousins that are 3-8. Email me if you are interested. We could maybe get a group rate.

Madeline

Kelli Traaseth <tktraas@...> wrote:
Just wondering,

Madeline and others familiar with Atlanta, have you ever been to the Center for Puppetry Arts?

I was looking at things to do when we are there (before the conference) and saw they are performing Alice in Wonderland while we are there.

Just wondering if it is worth going to? It looks really cool.

Thanks,


Kelli~
